image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Not-for-profit pokies clubs in the Northern Territory are supposed to contribute part of their profits for the benefit of the wider community, but data shows some are effectively opting out of the voluntary scheme.

title.children: Clubs accused of 'whitewashing' pokies revenue through benefit scheme

image.altText: A waterfall on a rocky landscape, with green trees growing on all sides of the water.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's popular Litchfield National Park is set to expand by 20 per cent, giving Territorians and visitors more places to camp, four-wheel drive, swim and hunt.

title.children: Popular waterfalls to join Litchfield National Park in 30,000ha expansion

image.altText: A young girl using a walking aid, smiling as a woman nearby blows bubbles.

props.synopsis: The National Disability Insurance Agency is cutting travel allowances for physiotherapists, which some parents say will disadvantage their children living with disabilities — especially in regional and remote areas.

title.children: NDIS cuts to leave regional kids with less access to vital physiotherapy

image.altText: A white sedan stamped "certified shitbox"

props.synopsis: Recent strangers now lifelong friends after a week on the road have parted ways with their beloved "s***boxes" as the cancer research charity run culminated with an auction in Darwin on Saturday.

title.children: Beloved 's***boxes' find forever homes as charity rally comes to a close

image.altText: Horse racing at Brunette Downs track

props.synopsis: In the black-soil plains of the Barkly Tablelands, a champion racehorse called Rafferty Rules has etched itself into the history books.

title.children: 15yo 'Phar Lap of the Barkly' ends career with sixth Gold Cup on the trot

image.altText: A freight train travels through the outback with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Most "fresh" food travels thousands of kilometres to be sorted, divvied up and, in some cases, sent back to the place it came from — at huge cost to farmers and shoppers. But some new options are starting to sprout.

title.children: From freight to plate: The 'mind-boggling' journey of 'fresh' food

image.altText: Aerial shot of the riverside Queens Wharf development

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment has received notice that the Hong Kong investors poised to purchase its Brisbane casino stake want to terminate the sale. Follow live.

title.children: Star Entertainment's deal to sell Queen's Wharf casino stake on brink

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX picking up momentum, James Hardie jumps on merger success
Chinese manufacturing continues to shrink, but postive signs emerge in construction
Star shares higher despite Hong Kong investors backing out of Brisbane sale

image.altText: Gary Shallala Hudson sitting on steps outside of his home which was flooded in 2022

props.synopsis: A psychologist warns severe downpours in parts of NSW, including Sydney, Newcastle and the South Coast, could trigger anxiety for those who have endured recent flood events.

title.children: Flood survivors on edge as BOM forecasts torrential rain for parts of NSW

image.altText: A hand holds up blocks that read 01 July. Stacks of paper sit below

props.synopsis: Minimum wage, parental leave and road fines will increase in changes to laws this new financial year.

title.children: New laws, changes and payments coming into effect this financial year

image.altText: An exterior picture of the Department of Home Affairs.

props.synopsis: The nation's corruption watchdog has found a senior home affairs bureaucrat engaged in "serious" corruption for giving benefits to her sister and future brother-in-law. Follow live.

title.children: Senior home affairs bureaucrat engaged in 'serious' corruption, NACC finds

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Corruption watchdog finds senior home affairs official engaged in 'serious' corrupt conduct
Bowen says govt won't make Australia look like an 'unreliable supplier' of gas
Australia bidding against Türkiye to host COP31, Bowen says

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: The economic reform round table set down for August will talk about tax reform but a strategy for the future of artificial intelligence and robots should be part of the conversation.

title.children: Productivity and tax strategy can't ignore the impact of AI and robots

image.altText: A dark grey smoke cloud rising above a dark green forest on the backdrop of a blue sky horizon

props.synopsis: At least two firefighters have been killed when crews responding to a blaze in western Idaho started "taking sniper fire" from at least one suspect, a local sheriff says.

title.children: Man's body found with firearm after two firefighters killed in Idaho ambush

image.altText: smiling bald man holding dog

props.synopsis: Alexander Marinis, from Victoria, has been laid to rest and remembered as an intelligent and talented man. His identity puzzled Queensland detectives for more than a year after his body was found in the Maroochy River.

title.children: Man whose body was found in river identified after 14-month global search

image.altText: Rafael Grossi wearing a dark suit jacket, blue shirt and maroon tie looking to his left in front of a blurred blue UN flag

props.synopsis: The International Atomic Energy Agency's chief raises more doubt about the efficacy of the US bombing of key Iranian nuclear facilities, which Donald Trump maintains were "oblierated".

title.children: Iran could enrich uranium within months, UN nuclear watchdog says

image.altText: smelter factory external shots

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Liberty Bell Bay smelter is among several companies owned by the financially troubled GFG Alliance being taken to court by Australia's corporate regulator for failing to lodge annual reports.

title.children: Corporate regulator ASIC takes Liberty Bell Bay parent company to court

image.altText: The Care Squeeze Graphic no text

props.synopsis: Aged care changes due to come in on November 1 will see self-funded retirees and some pensioners expected to pay more, as future residential care and in-home care residents face a new regime.

title.children: Experts share tips for 'Sandwich Generation' as caregiving costs $18k a year

image.altText: Man with arms crossed and in black jacket looks sternly into the camera

props.synopsis: More than 80 per cent of unpaid superannuation goes unrecovered — and the agency in charge rarely penalises employers who do not pay it.

title.children: Compulsory super rises to 12pc from July 1, but millions are missing out

image.altText: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley National Press Club

props.synopsis: The issue of gender quotas is the one philosophical and cultural mountain that the Liberal Party has never been prepared to climb. Now former PM Malcolm Turnbull and senator Maria Kovacic are the latest Liberal names to weigh in.

title.children: Turnbull and Kovacic are latest to weigh in over gender quotas for the Liberal party

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand

props.synopsis: Many of us just want to get the business of doing their tax returns over and done with. Here's what you need to know before you start.

title.children: The new financial year starts tomorrow. Here's what that means for your taxes

image.altText: Virgil van Dijk lifts the Premier League trophy

props.synopsis: Optus Sport transfers its broadcast rights to the English Premier League to Nine Entertainment's Stan, ending a nine-year run of its football coverage.

title.children: Optus Sport customers set for discounts after Premier League rights transfer

image.altText: Someone sitting in front of a bank of computer screens, their shirt says "Shuffle" on the back

props.synopsis: Online casino Shuffle's executives are gambling on its own live broadcasts, despite it being banned in Australia.

title.children: A multi-million-dollar online lottery is bending Australia's laws

image.altText: Evin Prison bike

props.synopsis: Accounts from inside Tehran's Evin Prison are as harrowing as they are rare — many of those locked up inside never make it out. Now Iranian officials say 71 people were killed in an Israeli strike there last week.

title.children: Among all Israel's targets in Iran, this one left some 'in disbelief'

image.altText: Small children in military uniforms are shown rifles by uniformed military officers and a kindergarten teacher.

props.synopsis: China has long been accused of repression in Tibet and a new report based on rare firsthand accounts from people inside the region sheds light on the way authorities are trying to erase local culture and language.

title.children: The boarding schools where China tries to 'erase' young children's culture: report

image.altText: A photo of a laptop with a hand on the keyboard showing a photo of damage to a drywall.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken with several workers who are urgently calling for an independent complaints mechanism that allows reports to be made anonymously and without fear of reprisal.

title.children: Workers threatened with weapons and 'jumped' inside residential care homes

image.altText: An aerial artist rendering of a project

props.synopsis: Developers scrap a major green hydrogen export project in Gladstone, which was hailed as a pathway to helping achieve net zero emissions targets.

title.children: 'Sad day' as $14 billion green hydrogen export project axed

image.altText: Mundoolun crash

props.synopsis: Authorities say a man in his 30s has sustained "potentially life-threatening injuries" after a fire truck crashed into a tree.

title.children: Firefighter taken to hospital after truck crash south of Brisbane

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: Australia's only paper mill uses coal-fired boilers, which its new owner wants to convert to electric, but he says he has been told there is not enough local power in the Tasmanian grid to support this.

title.children: Paper mill owner told not enough power for coal to electric conversion

image.altText: A child in a sports jersey punches a punching bag.

props.synopsis: First Nations man and founder of Cuz Boxing Joe Hedger spends his days helping young people at risk. As Canberra raises the age of criminal responsibility to 14, services like his will be at the forefront of change.

title.children: 'They don't belong in jail': Age of criminal responsibility now 14 in ACT

image.altText: Whale breaching

props.synopsis: Hundreds of volunteers on Australia's east coast are braving the cold to catch whales migrating north to warmer waters for an annual whale census.

title.children: Whale sightings hit record high during citizen science migration count

image.altText: Mobile Intensive Care Ambulance (MICA) unit drives on a road in Geelong

props.synopsis: Leaked Ambulance Victoria communications reveal a struggle to fill shifts for highly trained intensive care paramedics in the Geelong region, with the union warning the agency's issues have reached "crisis level".

title.children: Dropped shifts for paramedics in Geelong region 'putting lives at risk'

image.altText: Frank hugging Annie, Annie stand on her hind legs hugging Frank, both facing each other. Dogs around them, grass & fence.

props.synopsis: Frank Finger says he has been "overwhelmed" with the outpouring of support from the community since the death of his wife Cathy and dog Annie.

title.children: Muster Dogs icon mourns loss of wife and champion dog two days apart

image.altText: A woman in black stands in front of a vivid blue painting.

props.synopsis: Wendy Whiteley reflects on the legacy of her late husband, Archibald Prize-winning artist Brett Whiteley, as his works appear at the only Victorian gallery to host his Inside The Studio exhibition.

title.children: Whiteley showcase reveals struggles with addiction and pursuit of beauty

image.altText: Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs NRLW captain Tayla Preston poses for a photograph.

props.synopsis: For Bulldogs co-captain Tayla Preston, representing the club in their inaugural NRLW season is an opportunity many years in the making.

title.children: Preston's NRLW Bulldogs dream decades in the making

image.altText: Photos of Press Club, Little Simz & Bon Iver sit over a collage of 2025 album covers

props.synopsis: Catch up on 2025's best new music from fine local talent, international favourites, exciting new voices, and beloved heavy hitters.

title.children: Need new music? These 20 albums are some of 2025's best so far
